meanings.definition: Housels (verb): to administer the Eucharist to
meanings.sent1: The priest housels the parishioners during the church service.
meanings.sent2: It is a sacred duty for the priest to housel the congregation.
meanings.sent3: The priest accidentally housels the wrong person, causing a moment of confusion.
meanings.sent4: The act of houseling brings spiritual nourishment to the believers.
meanings.sent5: The parishioners feel blessed after being houselled by the priest.

meanings.sent1: The faithful receive the housels during the communion.
meanings.sent2: The housels are an essential part of the religious ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The children were excited to taste the housels for the first time.
meanings.sent4: The housels symbolize the body and blood of Christ in the faith.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of the housels filled the church with a sense of holiness.
